p: Since prehistoric times, herbs were the basis for nearly all medicinal therapy until synthetic drugs were developed in the nineteenth century, a time when the prominence of herbal remedies gradually decreased in developed countries [ 1, 2]. Interest in herbal medicine has increased recently, with their efficacy again being researched and identified. Plant-based compounds and formulations for treatment of various ailments are becoming common place in society. Moreover, 75â€“80% of the world's population in developing countries continues to use herbal medicines for primary healthcare. However, quality assessments of herbal medicines are frequently lacking, something urgently required for the safety of users.
